column5: i want to put a kiker on the back of my prince craft but i have no way of mounting it but to put on a kiker bracket.how would i know if i need a long or short shaft motor?
Here's a site that will help you http://smalloutboards.com/shaft.htm

Easiest way to determine long or short..measure from the top of the transom to the bottom of the hull where you plan on mounting the motor.  15-16 inches is a short shaft, 20 inches give or take a bit is for a long shaft.  Remember that if you add a bracket that lowers the motor, you may end up flooding the motor with big waves that follow the boat.
